body.p: The output load can be manually transferred from one source to the other in the following transfer types, if the PDU is appropriately configured:

li.p:
Closed transition (make-before-break) transfer; both power sources must be synchronized to perform the transfer, and the load is not dropped.
One-stage, internal permissive signal only: operator uses the Color Monitor to verify that input sources are synchronized and send key release signal to the SKRU.
Two-stage, external plus internal permissive signals:
External signal: a normally open (NO) dry contact signal (usually sent by an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS)) enables the Color Monitor process
Internal signal: an operator uses the Color Monitor to verify that input sources are synchronized and to send a key release signal to the SKRU
External signal only: the SKRU key is unlocked by an external dry contact permissive signal; the Color Monitor does not verify source synchronization and does not send a permissive signal.
Open transition (break-before-make) transfer, load is dropped, typically used in offline maintenance.
